Hi,

I would like to request the list to suggest code coverage tool, which works
well with JUnit and Eclipse 3.2. 
I was using coverlipse, but as soon as I upgraded my eclipse to 3.2, the
Coverlipse Markers Views stop working. I have logged a bug with coverlipse,
but in the meantime I would appreciate of anyone can suggest any alternate
to Coverlipse.

Thanks,
-Kamal.
subject: code coverage tool that work well with JUnit and Eclipse 3.2
